and/or postulated sub-seafloor pools (hydrocarbon accumulations) that share common geologic, geographic, and temporal properties, such as history of hydrocarbon generation, migration, reservoir development, and entrapment. Geologic classifications of each play and its potential are described in the associated reports for each region. The analysis was based on seismic surveys analyzed by BOEM geologists.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:abstract>          <gmd:purpose>             <gco:CharacterString>To support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Energy Policy Act, Coastal Zone Management Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:purpose>          <gmd:status>             <gmd:MD_ProgressCode No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>                <gmd:measureDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:measureDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:lineage>             <gmd:LI_Lineage>                <gmd:processStep>                   <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                      <gmd:description>                         <gco:CharacterString>For each of the six source locations, import shapefiles into a single gdb. Check the projection of each feature class, and if not done so already, project each into NAD 83. Delete feature classes old unprojected versions of feature classes. Union all NAD 83 feature classes into a single feature class with No Gaps Allowed. Explode all multi-part polygons. Merge adjacent features together where there may have been gaps, overlaps, or slivers in the source data. For features where multiple plays overlap, keep these plays listed in one of the six play fields and delete all superfluous fields. These may need to be researched by looking thru the associated document listed as the source link. Integrate feature class to update integrity of shared feature boundaries. Add acres field and calculate geometry using Acres US. Check geometry and project data into WGS 1984 Auxiliary Sphere. Merge all six locations into a single feature class.</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:description>                      <gmd:dateTime>
